search
Class Search

java.lang.Object
  search.Search

public class Search
extends java.lang.Object

The Search class is a utility class that searches the database for Movies, or Members. It can also retrieve specific movies or members given their unique barcode numbers. Currently there are only four methods that can be called: Searching for a GeneralMovie Searching for a RentalMovie Searching for a Customer Browsing by genre Generating lists of Top 10 or most recent releases are to be implemented at a later date, in Tier 3 functionality.

Method Detail

searchCustomers

public static java.util.ArrayList<account.Customer> searchCustomers(java.lang.String lastName,
                                                                    java.lang.String phoneNum)
                                                             throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
searchCustomers takes the name of a member or his phone number and searches the database for matches. A maximum of one parameter may be null. A list of Customers that match are returned.

Parameters:
lastName - the name of the customer. Not case sensitive.
phoneNum - the 9 digit phone number of the customer.
Returns:
a list of Customers that match the search criteria, or null if no matching accounts could be found
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a connection with the database cannot be made
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - TODO: is memberID a string or an integer? how long is it?

getCustomer

public static account.Customer getCustomer(int memberID)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
This method retrieves the Customer account with the provided member ID from the database. Depends on both the Customer class and the customer table in the database.

Parameters:
memberID - the unique identifying number of the member
Returns:
the member's account, or null if the member ID did not match any records
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a connection with the database cannot be made
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the driver cannot be found

searchMovies

public static java.util.ArrayList<inventory.GeneralMovie> searchMovies(java.lang.String searchTerm,
                                                                       java.lang.String searchType)
                                                                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                                       inventory.MovieNotFoundException,
                                                                       java.io.IOException,
                                                                       java.lang.Exception
This method will search for a movie by a specified attribute. The attributes searchable are title, director, actors, and genre. This method looks for a GeneralMovie and is intended to be used by customers.

Parameters:
searchTerm - the term that the user is searching for
searchType - the kind of search the user is making. It can be either title, director, actors, or genre
Returns:
a list of movies that match the search criteria, or null if no movies are found, or null if the search type is not recognized.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
inventory.MovieNotFoundException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.Exception

searchMovies

public static java.util.ArrayList<inventory.GeneralMovie> searchMovies(java.lang.String title,
                                                                       java.lang.String actors,
                                                                       java.lang.String director)
                                                                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                                       inventory.MovieNotFoundException,
                                                                       java.io.IOException,
                                                                       java.lang.Exception
This method searches the database for a GeneralMovie matching the passed search criteria. At least one of the fields must be filled in. The main purpose of this search is to give the searcher an idea of what movies are carried by the store and their availability, without overwhelming him with information about the individual copies. This differs from searchRentals because the searchRentals will return a list of each individual RentalMovies wheras this method only returns the general movie information shared by all copies with the same SKU.

Parameters:
title - The title of the movie.
actors - A list of actors who are in the movie. Multiple actors should be separated by commas.
director - The director of the movie
Returns:
a list of movies matching the search criteria. May return null if no matches could be found.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a connection with the database cannot be made
SanitizerException - if the passed parameters contain SQL queries
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
inventory.MovieNotFoundException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.Exception

previewMovie

public static inventory.GeneralMovie previewMovie(java.lang.String barcodeID)
                                           throws inventory.MovieNotFoundException,
                                                  java.sql.SQLException,
                                                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                  java.io.IOException,
                                                  java.lang.Exception
This method decides if the passed barcode is a single SKU, in which case it returns a GeneralMovie object, or an IndividualMovie barcode. This method is used when the caller knows the exact barcode number. If this is not the case, use the search method.

Parameters:
barcodeID - the unique identifying number of the movie
Returns:
the movie that corresponds to the barcodeID
Throws:
inventory.MovieNotFoundException
java.sql.SQLException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.Exception

searchRentals

public static java.util.ArrayList<inventory.RentalMovie> searchRentals(java.lang.String title,
                                                                       java.lang.String[] actors,
                                                                       java.lang.String director,
                                                                       java.lang.Integer memberID)
                                                                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                                       java.io.IOException,
                                                                       inventory.MovieNotFoundException,
                                                                       java.lang.Exception
This method searches the database for a rental movie matching the search criteria. At least one of the fields must not be null. This differs from the searchVideo method by finding every single rental copy available. Therefore it will not search movies that are not carried by the store. TODO: possibly make this IndividualMovie to cover saleSearch too

Parameters:
title - the title of the movie
actor - an actor in the movie
director - the director of the movie
memberID - the member who is currently renting this
Returns:
a list of videos that match the search criteria, or null if no matching videos could be found.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database connection cannot be made
SanitizerException - if any search terms contain SQL commands
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
java.io.IOException
inventory.MovieNotFoundException
java.lang.Exception
